Job Title: Project Lead, Project Management

Location: Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Overview

Job Purpose

ICE Clear Credit (ICC), a subsidiary of Intercontinental Exchange, Inc., is looking for a Project Lead for both ICE Link (a flexible post-trade messaging and workflow system for the global credit derivatives market) and ICE Clear Credit (the worldâ€™s largest Clearing House for Credit Default Swaps). The Project Lead will be responsible for the execution of highly complex programs that consist of multiple projects. The Project Lead is responsible for meeting key performance objectives, managing issues to resolution, managing risk, managing program scope changes effectively, and ensuring that the work completed adheres to all company and department standards and processes. The Project Lead must be self-motivated, results-oriented, meticulous in detail and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment. This role requires frequent interaction with business stakeholders, project managers, developers, quality assurance, and infrastructure teams to ensure the delivery of a quality system.

Responsibilities

Manage multiple complex projects within a program or several unrelated projectsDetermine and negotiate project goals and priorities with stakeholders and sponsors, establish and publish clear project priorities for the team, and prepare project plans along with other deliverablesSet, track, and report release planning milestones through full life cycle of a project, from inception through release including:Identify, document, and escalate project risks and issues to sponsors and stakeholders.Develop, measure, and monitor project plans and schedulesMonitor key deliverables for completeness and accuracyEnsure resource availability and allocationUse appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project scope and scheduleDefine Project Level KPIs for reporting progressMeasure project performance using appropriate systems, tools, and techniquesEnsure all reporting tools reflect correct state and status of releaseEnsure project stakeholders are informed of progress and issuesCommunicate project status to senior management to ensure that project priorities and status are understood.Create implementation plans for deployments and track through completionDemonstrate consistency across release management practices and processesAssist in the ongoing development of best-practice project management and iterative development methodologies including rollout/training to team members as necessaryActively participate in strategic planning discussions with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Knowledge And Experience

Must be highly engaged, assertive, entrepreneurial in spirit with respect for processes, accountability, and decision traceability as well as aspire towards leadership4+ years plus of experience in a project management role involving iterative software development methodologies (Agile, RUP, SCRUM)Experience working with senior leadership teams to identify and address issues related to planning and strategy, framing key decisions, and facilitating prioritization of initiativesThe candidate needs to exhibit good business judgment, the ability to direct and critique the work of others while maintaining a collaborative team environment.Demonstrates disciplined change control procedures to ensure scope fluctuations are handled correctly and in a timely mannerWorks effectively in a fast-paced, sometimes stressful environment with rapidly changing priorities, requirements, and timelinesExcellent analytical, problem-solving skillsKnowledge of Financial Market Infrastructure is preferredJIRA knowledge and experience is preferredKnowledge and understanding of Cobit 5 is a plus

Schedule

This role offers work from home flexibility of up to 2 days per week.

Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or ancestry, age, disability or veteran status, or other protected status.

Experience Level (if available): None
